intro: Racosperma roycei, commonly known as the Royal's raceme acacia, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, arranged in racemate inflorescences, and are accompanied by small, feathery stipules. Racosperma roycei is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
